result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory T Malsack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 171 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
The Court will consider early termination of probation after 2 years based on Agent's recommendation.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to restitution.  Balance of restitution to be paid to Tyler R. as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
Agent to determine use of alcohol.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Any contact with victims (Tyler R., Michelle M., Brittany M. and Andrew M.) to be determined and approved by Agent.
Domestic Violence Counseling.
Destruction of forfeited knife and gun.
Letter of apology to victims.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 2.
